p: The findings concerning which microorganisms are found in respiratory samples vary with the type, anatomical site, and severity of infection. Consequently, if results from diverse studies, locations, and time periods are to be usefully considered, standardized case definitions must be used. Recently, the World Health Organization (WHO), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and researchers have developed case definitions for studies of ILI and SARI.
